Google gives wrong answer to “CET time now”
text:
If you ask Google for a CET time then it gives the wrong answer (cest time) as the most prominent response. Only in fine print it shows that the CET is one hour behind CEST.

It can (and has) lead to missed meetings if parties decide on cet time and only one of them asks Google.

19:45 Thursday, 7 July 2022 Central European Time (CET)

19:45 Brussels, Belgium (CEST)

19:45 Madrid (CEST)

19:45 Paris (CEST)

19:45 Rome (CEST)

19:45 Berlin (CEST)

19:45 Budapest (CEST)

18:45 Algiers [El Djazaïr] (CET)

18:45 Tunisia (CET)

Why are we not talking everyday about solving climate change?
text:
Here is an existential threat looming on us. Italy is seeing one of the most severe drought in 70 years, Marmolada glacier just collapsed killing 10 people (more are dispersed). Italian agricultural production will be down - 30% this year. There is a high probability of a food crisis in the upcoming years. We have a 50% probability of surpassing 1.5 degree in the next five years, the 1.5 degree limit was set in the Paris agreement because it is considered to be safe. Scary feedback loops like the permafrost one are waiting us reinforcing the warming even more.

So what are we doing as humanity to solve this problem? Nothing. What do you think we should do? why do you think we aren't talking about it?

Ask HN: Anyone with ppc64le and s390x boxes to test a Docker image?
text:
I moved my IBM370 VM/370 docker container image to multi-arch but I don’t have a RISCV (or POWER, or s390x) metal running Docker to make sure Hercules starts up correctly.

There is more information on https://hub.docker.com/r/rbanffy/vm370. Platform-specific tags are on https://hub.docker.com/r/rbanffy/vm370/tags and (you shouldn’t trust me and run my container images) the GitHub repo that has the specs is at https://github.com/rbanffy/vm370

Ask HN: Should we call it 'aesthetics' instead of 'technical debt'?
text:
There's a couple reasons I don't feel the term 'technical debt' is very good:

- There's an implication that it should be 0, but anyone who's ever worked on a large enough project will tell you that any large project will have some technical debt. When you get down to practical implementation there's always tradeoffs that have no single clear answer

- There's this dissonance where the things that are called 'technical debt' are potentially serious enough to cause problems, but not serious enough for anyone to actually prioritize dealing with them.

Using the description 'aesthetics' makes more sense to me

- I think it's inherent that aesthetics has a subjective element and that there's no way to drive it down to 0 or 100 or whatever.

- I think it helps with prioritization by setting the right context. "Removing technical debt" doesn't sound like a particularly productive activity, but "improving aesthetics," while clearly not as high priority as, say, "improving functionality," at least carries the connotation that something will get improved as a result of the work, even if it's something not totally tangible.

What are HN's thoughts? Are there other words besides aesthetics or technical debt we could/should be using?

Ask HN: Podcasts on how to make friends and become more sociable?
text:

Ask HN: Low level programming forums and communities?
text:
Hello all,

I’be only recently gotten into low level programming, but I was curious if there are any online communities that exist for it?

I really enjoy going into forums and seeing showcases and discussion (one of the best parts of HN!), so I was curious if there is anything specific like that.

EDIT: I should add conferences are cool too. I am aware of HandMade Seattle already, which I think is kinda the peak one, unless you do specific lang conferences like RustConf or CppCon.
